intro: Cyrtogonellum fraxinellum, commonly known as the golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine, silky hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Cyrtogonellum fraxinellum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
